title: Bruins Hampus Lindholm earns late call to Winter Olympics for Sweden
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins “I haven't had any opportunities for the Olympics for me in my career so far.
" Hampus Lindholm will represent Sweden at the Winter Olympics.

title: Here’s what readers thought about MBTA service during the snowstorm
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “Our driver was a rockstar!
Handled the ice/snow/slush easily and avoided collisions with inexperienced drivers and inattentive pedestrians with ease.
” The MBTA Mattapan-Ashmont Trolley makes it way toward Milton Station during a snow squall on February 9, 2025 in Boston.

title: Tufts urges community to report sightings of immigration officials after agents spotted near campus
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The chief of the university’s police department warned students and staff to stay vigilant in light of the recent sightings.
Officials at Tufts University warned students and staff Tuesday about federal immigration activity near campus.
Suzanne Kreiter/The Boston Globe Officials at Tufts University urged the community to report sightings of immigration officials Tuesday after they were alerted about federal activity near the campus.

title: Former Patriots, sports legends react to Bill Belichick Hall-of-Fame snub
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "I mean this is crazy.
What are we even voting on?
" Bill Belichick's Hall-of-Fame snub rankled Julian Edelman and several of his former players.

title: Haverhill police officers involved in man’s death won’t face charges, DA announces
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The medical examiner found no injuries to Francis Gigliotti’s nose, throat, neck, or neck muscles, nor any bruises or injuries on his back.
Francis Gigliotti being held down by Haverhill police July 11 and later died.
Essex County District Attorney's Office ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Broncos fire several coaches, including offensive coordinator, after loss to Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Offensive coordinator Joe Lombardi is out, along with a receivers coach and a cornerbacks coach.

Former Broncos OC Joe Lombardi AP Photo/David Zalubowski The Broncos announced Tuesday that they have parted ways with three assistant coaches in the aftermath of their AFC title game loss to the Patriots.
Offensive Coordinator Joe Lombardi, Wide Receivers Coach Keary Colbert, and Cornerbacks Coach Addison Lynch are no longer with the team.

title: Having difficulty getting a 12-year-old SUV to start
author: John Paul
bullets: How To John Paul, AAA Northeast's Car Doctor, hears from a reader with an SUV that’s become difficult to start.
The Car Doctor hears from a reader with an SUV that’s become difficult to start.

title: Suffolk DA Hayden joins growing list of Mass. officials condemning ICE action in Minneapolis
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The DA released a statement Tuesday decrying the Trump administration’s “cruel and deceitful slanders” of Alex Pretti and Renee Good.
Suffolk County District Attorney Kevin Hayden called federal immigration agents a threat to "citizens everywhere.

" Jonathan Wiggs/The Boston Globe Suffolk County District Attorney Kevin Hayden lambasted the Trump administration in a statement Tuesday following the killings of Renee Good and Alex Pretti by federal agents in Minneapolis.

title: ‘You ain’t beating Seattle’: Stephen A. Smith predicts Patriots Super Bowl loss
